filmography.title: Golden Boy
filmography.role_description: The protective Italian father of a violinist-turned-boxer who wants a better life for his son.
filmography.plot: A young man with a talent for the violin is torn between a career in music and the quick money of professional boxing.

filmography.title: The Song of Bernadette
filmography.role_description: The skeptical town physician who is scientifically baffled by the miraculous cures occurring at Lourdes.
filmography.plot: In 1858 France, a peasant girl's vision of a 'beautiful lady' brings controversy and eventually healing to her town.

filmography.title: Anna and the King of Siam
filmography.role_description: The stern and powerful Prime Minister of Siam who is wary of the British governess's influence.
filmography.plot: An English widow travels to Siam to become the governess to the King's children, engaging in a battle of wills and cultures.

filmography.title: Boomerang!
filmography.role_description: A police chief under intense political pressure to solve the murder of a priest, arresting a vagrant to satisfy the public.
filmography.plot: A prosecutor faces political pressure to convict a vagrant for the murder of a beloved priest, but he believes the man is innocent.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Captain from Castile
filmography.role_description: A jovial, adventurous fortune hunter who joins Hernán Cortés on his expedition to Mexico.
filmography.plot: A young Spanish officer fleeing the Inquisition joins Cortez's expedition to the New World.

filmography.title: Call Northside 777
filmography.role_description: A skeptical newspaper editor who initially doubts his reporter's quest to prove a convict's innocence.
filmography.plot: A reporter proves a washerwoman's son innocent of the murder of a policeman 11 years after he was imprisoned.

filmography.title: The Dark Past
filmography.role_description: A police psychiatrist who is held hostage by an escaped convict and uses psychoanalysis to disarm him.
filmography.plot: A psychiatrist is held hostage by a fugitive killer and uses the time to analyze the criminal's nightmares.

filmography.title: Thieves' Highway
filmography.role_description: A corrupt and ruthless produce dealer in San Francisco who cheats truck drivers out of their earnings.
filmography.plot: A war veteran truck driver seeks revenge on the crooked produce dealer who crippled his father and stole his truck.

filmography.title: Sirocco
filmography.role_description: A dedicated French intelligence officer in Damascus who tries to stop gunrunners aiding the Syrian rebels.
filmography.plot: A cynical American gunrunner in 1925 Damascus gets caught between French occupying forces and Syrian rebels.

filmography.title: On the Waterfront
filmography.role_description: The menacing, corrupt union boss who controls the docks with an iron fist and orders the deaths of those who testify.
filmography.plot: An ex-prize fighter turned longshoreman struggles to stand up to his corrupt union bosses.

filmography.title: The Left Hand of God
filmography.role_description: A powerful Chinese warlord who refuses to let his favorite pilot, disguised as a priest, leave his service.
filmography.plot: An American pilot posing as a priest in China tries to escape a warlord while protecting a mission.

filmography.title: The Man in the Gray Flannel Suit
filmography.role_description: An honest, philosophical judge who questions the validity of a will, providing moral grounding in the corporate drama.
filmography.plot: An ex-soldier faces ethical questions as he tries to earn enough to support his wife and children in the corporate world.

filmography.title: 12 Angry Men
filmography.role_description: A belligerent, prejudiced juror whose personal vendetta against his own son drives his desire to convict the young defendant.
filmography.plot: A jury holdout attempts to prevent a miscarriage of justice by forcing his colleagues to reconsider the evidence.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: The Three Faces of Eve
filmography.role_description: The patient psychiatrist who treats a woman suffering from multiple personality disorder.
filmography.plot: A doctor treats a timid housewife who suffers from dissociative identity disorder, manifesting three distinct personalities.

filmography.title: The Garment Jungle
filmography.role_description: A dress manufacturer who staunchly opposes unionization, unaware of his partner's mob connections.
filmography.plot: A garment center owner fights against unionization, hiring thugs to keep the union out, leading to violence.

filmography.title: The Brothers Karamazov
filmography.role_description: The debauched, domineering patriarch of the Karamazov family whose actions tear his sons apart.
filmography.plot: The lives of four brothers are forever changed by their father's murder and the conflicts over money and love.

filmography.title: Man of the West
filmography.role_description: A deranged, aging outlaw leader who forces his former protégé (Gary Cooper) to participate in a bank robbery.
filmography.plot: A former outlaw is forced by his old gang to participate in a train robbery, but he plans to turn the tables on them.

filmography.title: Party Girl
filmography.role_description: A vicious 1930s mob boss who refuses to let his lawyer leave the organization.
filmography.plot: A lawyer for the mob tries to quit the rackets when he falls in love with a dancer, but the boss won't let him go.

filmography.title: Exodus
filmography.role_description: A pragmatic Jewish leader negotiating for the creation of the State of Israel, often clashing with his militant brother.
filmography.plot: The theme is the founding of the state of Israel. The action begins on a ship filled with Jewish immigrants bound for Israel.

filmography.title: How the West Was Won
filmography.role_description: A town marshal who tries to keep the peace during the building of the railroad.
filmography.plot: A family saga covering several decades of Westward expansion in the 19th century, including the Gold Rush and the Civil War.

filmography.title: Come Blow Your Horn
filmography.role_description: A grumpy, artificial fruit manufacturer who is exasperated by his playboy son's lifestyle.
filmography.plot: A young man leaves his parents' home to live with his swinging older brother in New York City.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Our Man Flint
filmography.role_description: The exasperated chief of Z.O.W.I.E. who must recruit the retired super-spy Derek Flint to save the world.
filmography.plot: When scientists use a weather control machine to blackmail the world, super-spy Derek Flint is called out of retirement to stop them.

filmography.title: Coogan's Bluff
filmography.role_description: A cynical New York City police detective who clashes with a cowboy deputy sheriff (Clint Eastwood) tracking a fugitive.
filmography.plot: An Arizona deputy sheriff travels to New York City to extradite an escaped murderer, clashing with local police methods.

filmography.title: The Liberation of L.B. Jones
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, racist lawyer in the South who refuses to represent a black man in a divorce case.
filmography.plot: A wealthy black undertaker in a small Southern town wants a divorce from his wife, who is having an affair with a white policeman.

filmography.title: The Exorcist
filmography.role_description: A film-loving homicide detective investigating the mysterious death of a director, leading him to a possessed girl.
filmography.plot: When a teenage girl is possessed by a mysterious entity, her mother seeks the help of two priests to save her.
